resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #3295: ARROW-3846: [Gandiva][C++] Build Gandiva C++ libraries and get unit tests passing on Windows
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3295
 
 
   The tests pass cleanly for me on Windows with these changes. Can't say this was the most enjoyable project. I will fix up the CI but wanted to get eyes on the changes in case anything looks undesirable
   
   Some notes
   
   * This requires that LLVM was built with CMake, which is not true
     of the Windows installers from llvm.org. It works for me if I
     `conda install llvmdev=6.0.1 clangdev=6.0.1`
   * I had to suppress a ton of compiler warnings that seem to be
     coming from the LLVM headers. see gandiva/llvm_includes.h
   * Unix targets are still using strptime for date parsing. We
     might want to use `arrow/vendored/date.h` on all platforms
     unless there is some significant performance difference
   * This doesn't build in Appveyor yet. I wanted to wait to see which
     builds folks think we should add this too (build times will go up
     because installing llvmdev/clangdev will be time consuming)
   * Python or other bindings will have to be investigated in a separate patch
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the

 ##########
 @@ -57,7 +58,7 @@ Status DateUtils::ToInternalFormat(const std::string& format,
   std::stringstream buffer;
   bool is_in_quoted_text = false;
 
-  for (uint i = 0; i < format.length(); i++) {
+  for (int i = 0; i < format.length(); i++) {
 
 Review comment:
   This causes warning on Linux:
   
   ```text
   cpp/src/gandiva/date_utils.cc: In static member function 'static gandiva::Status gandiva::DateUtils::ToInternalFormat(const string&, std::shared_ptr<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char> >*)':
   cpp/src/gandiva/date_utils.cc:61:21: warning: comparison of integer expressions of different signedness: 'int' and 'std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>::size_type' {aka 'long unsigned int'} [-Wsign-compare]
      for (int i = 0; i < format.length(); i++) {
                      ~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
   cpp/src/gandiva/date_utils.cc:120:33: warning: comparison of integer expressions of different signedness: 'std::__cxx11::basic_string<char>::size_type' {aka 'long unsigned int'} and 'int' [-Wsign-compare]
            if (format.length() - 1 > i) {
                ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~
   ```
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

pitrou commented on pull request #3295: ARROW-3846: [Gandiva][C++] Build Gandiva C++ libraries and get unit tests passing on Windows
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3295#discussion_r244978463
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/gandiva/selection_vector.cc
 ##########
 @@ -48,8 +50,18 @@ Status SelectionVector::PopulateFromBitMap(const uint8_t* bitmap, int64_t bitmap
     uint64_t current_word = bitmap_64[bitmap_idx];
 
     while (current_word != 0) {
+#if defined(_MSC_VER)
+#pragma warning(push)
+#pragma warning(disable : 4146)
+#endif
+      // MSVC warns about negating an unsigned type. We suppress it for now
       uint64_t highest_only = current_word & -current_word;
 
 Review comment:
   This loop looks quirky to me. IIUC it processes all set bits in `current_word`, from LSB to MSB? e.g. if `current_word = 0b001001101`, then pos_in_word will be `0`, `2`, `3` then `6`?
   
   If so, then one should be able to write this:
   ```cpp
   pos_in_word = CountTrailingZeros(current_word);
   current_word -= (1 << pos_in_word);
   ```
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

     while (current_word != 0) {
+#if defined(_MSC_VER)

       uint64_t highest_only = current_word & -current_word;
 
 Review comment:

wesm commented on issue #3295: ARROW-3846: [Gandiva][C++] Build Gandiva C++ libraries and get unit tests passing on Windows
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3295#issuecomment-452462941
 
 
   I rebased and got things compiling again, but I can't get any of the unit tests to run now
   
   ```
   (arrow-dev) λ release\Release\gandiva-if_expr_test.exe                              
   Running main() from gtest_main.cc                                                   
   [==========] Running 6 tests from 1 test case.                                      
   [----------] Global test environment set-up.                                        
   [----------] 6 tests from TestIfExpr                                                
   [ RUN      ] TestIfExpr.TestSimple                                                  
   unknown file: error: SEH exception with code 0xc0000005 thrown in the test body.    
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestSimple (26 ms)                                          
   [ RUN      ] TestIfExpr.TestSimpleArithmetic                                        
   unknown file: error: SEH exception with code 0xc0000005 thrown in the test body.    
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestSimpleArithmetic (26 ms)                                
   [ RUN      ] TestIfExpr.TestNested                                                  
   unknown file: error: SEH exception with code 0xc0000005 thrown in the test body.    
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestNested (26 ms)                                          
   [ RUN      ] TestIfExpr.TestNestedInIf                                              
   unknown file: error: SEH exception with code 0xc0000005 thrown in the test body.    
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestNestedInIf (25 ms)                                      
   [ RUN      ] TestIfExpr.TestNestedInCondition                                       
   unknown file: error: SEH exception with code 0xc0000005 thrown in the test body.    
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestNestedInCondition (25 ms)                               
   [ RUN      ] TestIfExpr.TestBigNested                                               
   unknown file: error: SEH exception with code 0xc0000005 thrown in the test body.    
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestBigNested (26 ms)                                       
   [----------] 6 tests from TestIfExpr (165 ms total)                                 
                                                                                       
   [----------] Global test environment tear-down                                      
   [==========] 6 tests from 1 test case ran. (165 ms total)                           
   [  PASSED  ] 0 tests.                                                               
   [  FAILED  ] 6 tests, listed below:                                                 
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestSimple                                                  
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestSimpleArithmetic                                        
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestNested                                                  
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestNestedInIf                                              
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestNestedInCondition                                       
   [  FAILED  ] TestIfExpr.TestBigNested                                               
                                                                                       
    6 FAILED TESTS                                                                     
   ```
   
   I no longer have access to the machine where I initially did this work, so this is on a fresh Windows machine. I am going to need some help to figure out why the segfault is happening. Can someone please help? If we don't get these tests running in Appveyor soon the technical debt associated with supporting Windows will continue to pile up with each new Gandiva patch
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: I started briefly looking at this. As an initial matter, our FindLLVM.cmake is inadequate. There's one (BSD-licensed) we can pull in from the LLVM-based D compiler: https://github.com/ldc-developers/ldc/blob/master/cmake/Modules/FindLLVM.cmake. If someone can point out another one, I can take a look.
